alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Marshall (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 4:43PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Marshall...southwestern Jackson and southeastern Madison Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 442 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Grant, or 10 miles southwest of Scottsboro, moving east at 25 mph. A second strong thunderstorm was located just south of Gurley. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scottsboro, Owens Cross Roads, Grant, Section, Woodville, Dutton, Langston, Paint Rock, Lim Rock and Hampton Cove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A severe thunderstorm watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for north central and northeastern Alabama.
